pros: The company has been around for a while and is stable overall but there can be a lot of turnover in some departments.
cons: This company pushes the Catholic faith quite hard. They pray before meetings and events and even "annoint" you when hired. But the issue is not necessarily them pushing Catholicism, it's the fact that beyond the praying, they dont act very Christian. From the medical director to the COO, CAO and CFO they wield a lot of power in a negative way. I heard one of them literally say "Im the boss, when I say jump you say how high" and "if you don't do X. Ill just fire you". While it is true that an employer can fire you for any reason in Texas, using profanity or being a jerk is taking it a bit too far. I am all for firing people for cause but that doesnt happen here. Promotions are also not based on merit but on the rapport you have with C level execs. They dont mind working you late during month end and will literally lay a guilt trip on you if you do not work late (like 11pm or midnight) when they ask you to. All in all, stay informed. If you can help it, don't work here, otherwise just know what you are getting into.

Communication to Employees
HR's attempt to connect with staff

let me tell you as if I were talking to a friend, compassion is non existent within management when you experience the death of someone close in relation to you.
as an employee, I was pushed to the point of a nervous breakdown without concern for my mental health, my emotional well-being or physical well-being as an employee. It was clearly known I had lost my spouse, I was advised I had three days to figure it out.
FMLA was drawn out to the point of remote far upper management questioning absences when I all legality they had no right to do so.
Being emotionally vulnerable and pushed beyond limits, I left a job of over five years due to disrespectful corporate management and their rules. I would not suggest you have any life circumstances occur while you work for Christus Trinity Mother Frances.

Policies and procedures are frequently overlooked or ignored until something goes wrong, then they come looking for scapegoats to fire.  There are so many incompetent leaders promoted into positions that they are not experienced in, trained for, or have the body of knowledge for, it makes a competency checklist fit for toilet paper. Oh, and there's probably a VP of Toilet Paper in there somewhere too, along with one for paperclips and printer cartridges. Corporate run the show even though many have forgotten what it looks like to work in a facility or be on the floor. Too many people in charge that should still be playing with Lego.

review_title: Doesn’t have much regard for their associates
pros: Enjoyed coworkers, certain people with administration. 403b benefits are good. Insurance isn’t horrible.
cons: Policies are somewhat followed, the ones they want to enforce. Pay is low compared to other companies. Short staffed often.  My reason for leaving the company was a new, and what seemed like an unsteady administration. Reducing the night differential to make it “fair” throughout Christus meant lowering the rate across the board instead of increasing to what the highest differential was. Why not satisfy your associates instead of make them mad? The last straw was that they were no longer paying out PTO that you had earned. It was use it or lose it. After putting my resignation in prior to that policy change, my leaving date was after the status change, therefore they did not pay me out the PTO I had earned. I will never understand how a company can be so concerned about patient satisfaction and not understand in order to do so your associates who make those patients satisfied, need to be happy. Happy associates make happy patients.

review_title: Prefer for my title to remain anonymous
pros: Pay is acceptable, covered parking, and most of your co-workers are really nice but that is about all. Nothing more comes to mind.
cons: This is the most UNETHICAL organization I've worked for. There are so many things wrong with this company! Please stay away and do not apply! They DO NOT hire top quality candidates or management. People have jobs in research, clinical trials, and they are not qualified! They have high school diplomas and don't understand IRB processes. I believe patient lives will be affected one day with the under qualified and uneducated people they hire. They don't have the right systems and tools in place. No one can find anything or direct you to the right place/person for an answer. You can't trust HR. They are a joke and disclose information to your leadership that should be confidential. I feel like I was duped. I thought I was working for a great non-profit hospital. Wrong! It's the worst company I have worked for and encourage you not to apply.

review_title: Was a great place to work, before the 'consolidation' to Las Colinas
job_title: Enterprise Systems Administrator in San Antonio, TX
pros: Good benefits, competitive salary for the area, work from home 3 days a week, new technologies implemented frequently, usually had at least one week of paid training a year
cons: In January of 2012, Ernie's vision of consolidation was all along just a massive work force reduction. Apparently having Information Management staff located at the various locations throughout Texas and Louisiana no longer 'worked', so Ernie decided he'd try to uproot everyone to Las Colinas.  We're talking over 500 dedicated, vested employees. Well that backfired, only a very small percentage actually relocated (I've heard around 15%), the people who kept the systems running left, so now there are issues after issues and the expertise to resolve them are no longer there. Replace your tenured staff with new hires at a substantial salary savings, and you expect to be better off? I mean, do you want to be a patient at any of their facilities while they're having daily problems with their systems that are there to assist in providing for your care? Think about that...

review_title: This is the WORST career decision I have ever made- absolute career suicide- Worst Company I have ever worked for
pros: The pay is competitive for a small town work place
cons:
It does not matter how hard you work (and trust me, this job must be your entire life to succeed at all with this company), you will NOT be promoted unless you are "in" with the right people.  Even then, everyone at this company loves to point the finger at the next person for their own mistakes.  

There is absolutely no personal accountability with senior or even mid level management to admit fault on their own part.  Every day is a new blame game.  I was once ambitious- but I have learned over my years with this hospital that ambition only causes enemies and puts your face on the radar as someone that should actually be kept down, versus promoted in any way.  

This is a hospital to work for if you are ready to kill your career, and your future career options.  In no case in my experiences with man

pros: I honestly have no pros to mention about this place. I was employed for a short while and the first week out if training I knew I had made a mistake in accepting the position. cons: Terrible technology. Outdated systems, they use meditech. Open style work space, no cubicles, lack of privacy. Training needs improvement. No set procedures in place, no uniformity, everyone has a different way of doing things. When you leave trainibg, you sit with a "team lead" for maybe 2 days then you are expected to meet production that is hard to attain because their claims are all a mess, i.e incorrect coding, incorrectly pre applied contractual adjustments, lack of authorization, you name it.. too many meetings and huddles basically about nothing.

review_title: Run from this company. trust the reviews as i should have.
pros: OK benefits. Great co workers. Love that they have a chapel where you can go to pray.
cons: Horrible management. You get bullied by upper management and HR does nothing about it but go with the management side. Supervisors are retaliating and picking on employees in pfs department and nothing is being done about it. This is a fake faith based company because nothing that management does is of God. Run far away from company.retaliation is major at Christus and HR or the integrity line does not help the employees. They only help management. You get pulled in by management constantly over he say she say that only comes from what management wants to spread about people but yet the employees are taking the punch for it. If your faith is in God this is definitely not the company to work for. Management stick together no matter what. Harassment goes a long way without resolution. They have the highest turnover that I have ever seen.

review_title: Poor Management, Lack of funding, failure to meet their core values

cons: The  environment is toxic due to mismanagement, apathy towards the employees and lack of corporate funding to meet regulatory requirements.  The financial situation appears to be unstable and the employees are paying the price for the mismanagement through lack of funding and burdened with more work to cut costs. Too many old cronies have been hired who are  in over their heads for the positions they hold. NOT all employees are treated equally and HR is pro-management only and is of no assistance for real HR problem resolution. Upper Management does not want to address the major problems. Core values are ignored - they talk a good game but they do not practice them.  It appears corporate is divesting itself of US properties.

review_title: DO NOT LET THE COMPANY NAME FOOL YOU

job_title: RN BSN Case Manager in Dallas, TX

Management and Upper management did not make decisions based on fact, credentials,performance; was on a good old boy buddy or cousin system. Some at and near the top had and continued to step on and over others to get there with no intention of lending a hand up.  Some coworkers were allowed to follow a totally different set of rules due to their relationship with the manager.  Engaged in reverse discrimination against white American female and male. This was the worst in my 20 years of being a Nurse.

pros: A few charitable events, onsite cafeteria, some good coworkers

Management hires other toxic individuals to serve as their watchdogs. review_title: Do not work for this company

Employees are issued a laptop so you can telecommute when approved by manager.

The benefits are mediocre.

Some coworkers are nice, talented and very hardworking.
cons:
A very unorganized, unfriendly, toxic and chaotic work environment.

Favoritism is rampant. 

The Irving corporate office has a very high turnover rate.

The pay was very low when compared to the amount of work to be done and stressful conditions.

There is not a work life balance. The Irving corporate office is a very stressful place. 

One thing that I found jaw dropping is that I have talked to over ten recruiters in the last year and they all know how toxic the office environment is at CHRISTUS. They know because they have talked to so many past and current employees looking to leave CHRISTUS.

Do not work for this company.

review_title: Disappointing, promises made for benefits and salary that were NEVER kept by multiple departments.

review_title: It pays the bills, room for improvement.

review_title: Do not work for this company at this location...

review_title: Terrible management. Medical practice outdated. Company broke. Don't go here

review_title: Very Un-Organized, Strict and lack of leadership from the Management

cons: The way the employees are treated are  unfair, as an associate you are only allowed one personal item on your desk, you are not allowed music, headphones....tattoos must not be visible, they work off of too many systems, this is very similar to a "sweat shop" The floor in PFS is an "open concept" so you have no cubicles. They are totally understaffed for the amount of work they have.

pros: I enoy the people I work with. I've been offered opportunities for advancement. I've work days & nights on multiple units. Like any healthcare facility, occasionally we are understaffed, but I see this as more of a national problem than a company issue. We are usually staffed appropriately to provide safe care and that's more than I can say for many places.
cons: No holiday pay. Occasionally understaffed. Pay is ok but I wouldn't call it very competitive. However, there are I incentive programs to help you earn more if you put the energy into it.

review_title: Don't be fooled by the purple scarves and the crosses everywhere. This is "BUSINESS" as usual.
pros: Lovely accommodations, friendly co-workers. Lot's of room for advancement as the company is growing. Good opportunity to learn different aspects of healthcare. They have a lot of events to bolster teamwork and open communications and integrity. Pay and benefits are pretty good with a lovely urgent care clinic "Free" on campus. Most coworkers are at least "trying" to make it a better place, most have been hardworking and resourceful. Though I found this to be because you often do things with little or know training by anyone who has been there longer than 2 or 3 years who may not know themselves. They seem to always be hiring, its an excellent place to get your feet wet and if you don't know hat you are doing no one will be able to tell. Get in get what you need and move on. I was here maybe 4 months got a promotion into a position I had never heard of and told "here is the manual". Good luck.
cons: The company seems to perpetually "restructuring" though no structure is ever achieved or maintained uniformly departments seem to wok in silos, communication is stifled, Upper management is constantly insisting on integrity, team work etc. but no one is held accountable for anything. No one knows their job, and if you ask for information you often have to "find" the one person who knows everything or find it yourself getting a run around. You learn a lot but the learning is of your own effort and you may not often know you have done something wrong or right until the assignment just doesn't come back to you. It just seems like a lot of people learning something new for the first time all together. Inclusion and mentor programs seem to be a myth.

pros:

Company moves slowly to implement changes. Bad managers are given too many chances resulting in loss of talented people. Many teams are understaffed and overworked with no clear direction / voice on major projects.
Performance reviews are a Joke.

We have to use our PTO for every holiday that rolls around and if we don't have PTO, we simply do not get paid. Unless you are a nurse or a physician, there is no room for promotion. What you get hired as if what you will quit, retire, get fired as.

pros: The ability to transfer was present with the multiple campuses. Resources were easy to access when things were in question

review_title: Declining care and respect toward patients and staff

Hostile work environment with very high turnover. Lack of profitability with blame shifted downward while key people who caused (and continue to cause) financial woes are left blameless. Patient satisfaction very low in scoring and evident in day-to-day activities on patient floors. Recent decreases in benefit packages, and salaries have caused more turnover in key areas. Corporate takeover evident with emphasis on profit rather than community service, quality of care and patient satisfaction. Employee satisfaction at all time low. Core values in limbo.

review_title: Not the shining star it was

Christus prefers to hire new graduates because of lower salary requirements.  Has had to sell of a number of free standing day surgery centers due to competition and poor performance.

They treat employees like trash and throw them out at the slightest provocation to hide their own short comings.  This company has been headed downhill since Dr Royer stepped down as president.  In the last year new president Ernie Sadue has layed off 700 employees from Houston and hired incompetent replacements in the new Dallas headquarters. pros: A company where all levels of the hospital system was a team player.  Everyone gave special attention to focusing on providing every patient, their family and friends with the most compassionate care available.

pros: I have worked at CHRISTUS Health for over 10 years, and it is a great place to work. I regularly get to interact with senior executives, and I can tell that they really care about our Associates.  They invest in fun activities for us, and there are reflection rooms on every floor and a chapel on the first floor where they host a chapel service that is open to all faiths once a week. My coworkers are amazing people.
cons: Sometimes there can be confusion over who "owns" what or who is in charge of what.  This can sometimes affect regions vs. corporate.  But I think people really are motivated by the corporation's mission at the end of the day.

review_title: Decent Jobs with average pay.  Average to above average overall.
pros: Employers/employees friendly most of the time.  Respected place to work.  A busy hospital for a town of 50,000 people is centrally located, easy to reach.  Has been a solid employer in this community for many years. Many long term employees enjoy working there and plan to stay.
cons: Long Hours.  Moderate pay.  More attention should be paid to training employees once they have moved beyond the usual new-employee general in-service training. Training is average, but could be better. Emergency room is almost always overcrowded, sometimes with direct admit patients having to wait 8 hours or longer to get a hospital bed.

Culture is defined one way but actually practiced another. Since it is a Catholic organization devoted to follow teachings of Jesus Christ, it would be more helpful for management to take a cue from the sisters who founded the organization and treat all employees with respect and value individual differences.

review_title: Organization is run so poorly that it is dangerous to patients.

cons: Corporate laid off hundreds of staff and hired less-experienced replacements under the guise of a "corporate relocation". This was nothing but a reduction in force. The replacements are like deer in the headlights. This has severely impacted the business, which severely impacts patient care. System downtime, back-end problems, systems not being updated and maintained in a timely manner, problems with regulatory updates...

pros: Faith Based organization whose corporate office is located in Irving, Texas.
cons: System Directors and higher level management are micro managers and perfectionists.    There is high turnover in the corporate office and the human resources department has too much authority in my opinion.  PTO must be used for designated corporate holidays in which the corporate office is closed and there is no flexibility in this policy even though the corporate is closed more than the standard holidays.  In addition, System Directors are given extreme liberty in interpreting CHRISTUS policies and there are very diverse interpretations  between System Directors in the interpretation of the policies.  Working from home is not allowed even though several competing healthcare companies in the DFW area have this policy.

job_title: Director of Pharmacy in San Antonio, TX
pros: Competitive pay; rather new facility; 17 OR; ER; no ICU; access convenient to most parts of city; most co-workers competent and good.
cons: Lack of support!  Pharmacy was promised a Clean Room from before my hire. 16 months later, no clean room. Decision to merge with a sister facility resulted in return to manual billing when it could have been avoided. Not willing to outsource. Both presented avoidable liability to license. Not good.

pros: Tuition reimbursement, Mentorship Talent Management Program to assist with career path and goals. This is a Catholic faith-based organization, so community service is encouraged and Christian principles are welcome.
cons: Some departments, mostly accounting and patient financial services work late hours, so there is a lack of work-life balance. The company doesn't often promote from within and will overlook perfectly qualified individuals that have been with the company for years by not even considering them for advancement.

pros: The perks are amazing. The insurance is great and affordable. They even have an on site clinic for you and your family that's FREE! They show appreciation for the associates all the time. It may be through the KUDOS points site, a gift card, a certificate or some type of physical gift but your hard work never goes unnoticed here. The morale is high. Everyone is always excited to partake in the work fun we have. We work hard but we play just as much. Management is good and they communicate well which helps things run smoothly. I could retire from here
cons: i don't have any seriously

job_title: PFS Associate III in San Antonio, TX
pros:
They were there me when I had breast cancer.
Family oriented company and core values
decent wages (cost of living and merit raises)
New management have many good changes.... we are working to become more efficient.
Love the associate's I work with. I've never worked anywhere That I feel as comfortable as I do here. I'm  OPTIMISTIC  about the future

Computer servers are slow.
Many issues with computer software that effect production.
Open environment hard to get used to. (call center set up) Easily distracted.

pros: Good culture, flexible hours for associates, new building relocated in 2012, benefits are OK, health insurance could be better, 403b matching up to 2.5%, profit sharing [success sharing] is minimal for associates but gets larger at the system director level
cons: Below pay as a non-profit provider in the DFW metroplex, not  a good mentor program, not a lot of attention paid to career tracks which would be helpful,

pros: This company has some of the better corporate facilities you may encounter in the healthcare industry.  A 24-hour fitness center, excellent break areas, an atmosphere which formally approaches faith from an affirmative point of view.  I expect any applicant would be enthused to sign board after taking the tour of the building's impressive amenities.
cons:
In my many years working in various professional capacities in cyber security, never have I experienced anything which compares with the sheer enigma that is CHRISTUS Health... and in particular, the way in which the IT Security section was managed.  During my tenure at this company, CHRISTUS has stood watch as its cyber security talent evacuated, with eleven people departing, achieving a 125% turnover rate in just ten months--all of them resignations. I was astonished at how effortlessly the problem was attributed...always... to the last employee that walked out the door, never once considering that the matter may be with the hostile climate which drove them to leave.

My decision to leave this company was not an easy one. But contact with former colleagues helped corroborate my concerns as valid--each of them having witnessed astonishingly consistent patterns: team members were observed spoken to as children in front of others in meetings; another's path blocked in the hall to be subjected to an open scolding.  Team members occasionally seen instructed to stop asking task-oriented questions of members in other departments, and one analyst warned against sharing ideas which, in one Director's opinion, were simply a 'waste' of time.  Most of us in this team recounted a distinct sense of being 'professionally' harassed for exhibiting talent or drive exceeding whatever was considered "normal" for one's place.  And departing team members have each raised these same concerns with Human Resources, in addition to at least one management level above.  Unfortunately, all appear to have been unresponsive to their input..

All of this combined made for an environment where both reputation and rewards are tightly controlled. And this apparently works well--in spite of the fact that no one seems to stay in this team longer than a year, it's hard to see whether this company's highest leadership has taken notice of people's rapid departure as a sign of an ongoing problem at the management level.  And it's a problem which shows no sign of relenting until someone finally decides it may be time for a change.  If not for the team's sake, then for the sake of the company's stated mission to care for others as they would for themselves.

pros: PTO stands for paid time off, the time you earn bi-weekly, which is vacation, sick and holidays all rolled into one. After 22 years, I receive 10+ hours every two weeks which is way more than fair.  We receive an annual raise every year, 2-2.5% may not be a lot but you receive this every year; some employers don't give raises but once in a blue moon.  I am allowed to work FULL time from my home and have an amazing boss. Good benefits and the company pays half of the cost.
cons: There are cons at ANY job. My cons may not be someone else's cons...that is for each individual to figure out.

review_title: Not living the "mission" that they post on the website.
pros: The best thing about CHRISTUS is it's connection to the Catholic Church.  The influence of the Sisters of Charity is still felt in some areas of the organization.
cons: The leadership is sneaky and unethical.   There is only a sham compliance department, which does not investigate complaints.  The long term vision for the company is unclear, but over the past 12-18 months several facilities have been closed or sold.   No new hospitals have been opened or purchased and several key corporate leaders with significant tenure have been terminated.

pros: That it is and Faith based organization...
cons: They have you wear a certain color scrub based on your job title but it's really a way for you to be discriminated against, belittled, and looked down upon. Administrators, co-workers, and some patients treat you differently if you're a caretaker and not wearing blue scrubs (RN) colors. Oh and if you are a housekeeper or wear gray scrubs (gray is assumed to be Transporters but is also Cancer Treatment Center's scrub colors). The Cancer Treatment Center has the worst management team and they are very racist and disrespectful to "certain" employees. It's so obvious that the patients even notice the discrimination and former employees as well as current employees have reported this but nothing is being done.

job_title: Coordinator of Patient Accounts in Irving, TX
pros: Good benefits, holidays off, bi-weekly pay

review_title: The good leave and the rest stay...
pros: Nice building.  Nice gym.  Nice hard working people at the associate level.  Nice mission.  Plenty of challenges and learning opportunities.  It's a job and nothing more.
cons: If you like working at a place with self indulgent, entitled, hubris ridden, disconnected leadership, this is your place.  High turnover and low associate satisfaction is rampant.  Heroics and excessive overtime/work are the norm for associates in this chaotic, disorganized environment.   Leaders use associates for political cover.  Efforts by associates, top performers in particular, go largely unappreciated and unnoticed by leadership (a.k.a. the executive tier - middle management and up).  Associates are over taxed as leadership maintains regular schedules - attending conferences, conducting meetings (read - wine and dine) with vendors, taking vacations (the leadership vacation allotment is extremely generous), taking large bonuses in the neighborhood of 30% of base minimum and even more (associate's is less than 1% of base for many).  ...but hey... they think they deserve it and the associates do not...  This all occurs while top performers are left out in the cold.  Top performers at the associate level receive very little - very few promotions, measly bonuses, paltry vacation allotments.  What they do get is excessive work and overtime.  When working excessive overtime leadership is usually absent.  If this is what you are looking for, what's not to like?   It's not hard to see why many associates get fed up an finally leave.  The good leave and the rest stay as is usually the case with this type of environment.

pros:
*The salary was ok
*Most of my co-workers were tolerable and sane.
*I like the diversity initiative (race diversity).  My floor was very diverse.
cons:
* The company is blasphemous! It didn't really hit me until my first week in the office.  There mission is to "extend the healing ministry of Jesus Christ".  But JESUS NEVER CHARGED MONEY FOR HEALING, CHRISTUS DOES.  The name is even blasphemous if you can read between the lines. They need to change the mission and stop it now!  Nothing Christus does should or can be prepared to the AWESOME WORKS of JESUS CHRIST, not even a little bit .... I felt so bad being part of such a blasphemous thing.
* The PTO is terrible.  You have to use PTO for holidays, I read it a glassdoor review stating that and didn't believe it ... but yes it's true.  Never has that happened to me
* It's very cult like. You are forced to pray at every meetings, there's a weird new employee ceremony towards the end of the session, and on and so forth.  I'm a spiritual person but my spirituality and Christus spiritually are very different ... Christus is a blasphemous, phony spirituality.
* High turnover rate.  And it's mostly due to how unorganized most departments are and people are also quick to leave b/c Christus fires with ease if they don't think you're a cultural fit which is so subjective and usually unfair. 
*If you're out and gay, 9/10 you're not gonna feel welcomed here ... the place is homophobic and many of their non-discrimination policies don't include sexual orientation which isn't fair.  Gays should be allowed to work in a non hostile environment just like everyone else.  The ironic thing is there are plenty of gay men here lol.

pros: Some associates truly live and breath the mission. Free garage parking.
cons:
Unless you’re hiring on with a director title or above, you will be treated as expendable and worthless. 

Higher ups are terrifyingly cavalier about firing people. Please do not lie to yourself like I did and think it will be different for you. 

Employees with advanced degrees and experience from top-tier companies work daily under the constant threat of being fired. The only “safe” employees are those brought in by their family and friends. They also happen to be the only employees receiving promotions. 

It is very painful, working for someone who has no clue what they are doing, yet believes they are smarter and better than any of their SME associates, and constantly implies the threat of job loss. 

I truly regret taking this job. I am out the millisecond I land another job with comparable pay. It’s harder leaving with under a years’ worth of time, so I’m just grinning and bearing it until then. A lot of us are. 

My story is not unique. My situation is not unique. I hear this exact same thing from colleagues in other departments.

pros: Associates with the exception of higher management are Christians, easy to work with, and pleasurable team members to follow the mission of the organization.  The facility is a nice well-maintained facility with plenty of collaboration space.
cons:
I spent a prior two years working for very large successful organizations before accepting a position in the Christus IT department. In those organizations security leadership placed an emphasis on transparency and accessibility; management at the highest levels took the time to ensure the well being of their subordinates to maintain a low turn over and maximize their work product.  Christus leadership speaks of their Christian values and the desire to maintain a healthy environment, however lacks the fortitude to follow their own core values (dignity, integrity, excellence, compassion, and stewardship). 

Rationalizations and illegitimate answers from middle management are given to new prospects and senior management as to why turn over has been so high. The record is not reflective of the real truth; IT has been unable to retain qualified security professionals. I personally left as a result of the toxic and combative atmosphere, lack of true strategic direction, and upper management’s decision even when aware to hold those accountable in management to a higher standard.  Collaboration and siloing information toward other teams and even security team members is promoted and has created an antagonistic atmosphere in the organization and the team.  Security is not meant to be a roadblock or “funnel” but a partner for the business; a method for them to understand how to protect privacy and information, not secret police. Unprofessional attacks upon team members, other Christus associates, and customers occurred on a weekly basis. 


My decision to leave Christus was difficult and troubling, my desire to maintain personal stability and further the mission with some great individuals could not over come the lack of quality leadership and chaos. While there are plenty of good things that could be done to improve the organization, lack of governance support and the adversarial atmosphere will hinder the organization’s business and their patients. There are too many good places to work in cyber security as the rate for qualified professional runs in the negative, if given an opportunity to work here I would suggest a pass and continue on to another organization, where you can make a difference and do true security.
